turns.content: Write an outline for a two-topic essay. Topic 1 is my experiences with and my observations of anime. Topic 2 is my experiences with and my observations of my manga. Include a thesis sentence in the outline. Also include a list of five sources that I might be able to quote from for the essay.

I. Introduction
A. Background information on anime and manga
B. Importance of anime and manga in pop culture
C. Personal interest in anime and manga
D. Thesis statement

II. Topic 1: My experiences with and observations of anime
A. How I got into anime
B. Types of anime I've watched
C. Positive experiences with anime
D. Negative experiences with anime
E. Observations on the impact of anime on society

III. Topic 2: My experiences with and observations of manga
A. How I got into manga
B. Types of manga I've read
C. Positive experiences with manga
D. Negative experiences with manga
E. Observations on the impact of manga on society

IV. Comparison of anime and manga
A. Differences between the two
B. Similarities between the two
C. Which I prefer and why

V. Conclusion
A. Recap of experiences and observations
B. Importance of anime and manga in pop culture
C. Personal growth from exploring anime and manga

Thesis sentence: My experiences with and observations of anime and manga have allowed me to gain a deeper understanding of their impact on society, and have helped me to appreciate their value as a form of entertainment and artistic expression.

Sources:

1. "Anime and manga fandom and its influence on young people's language and culture learning" by Junko Yamashita
2. "The Influence of Japanese Comics and Animation on Language Learning and Literacy Development" by Lawrence Eng
3. "Why Manga Matters" by Paul Gravett
4. "The Aesthetics of Anime and Manga" by Dani Cavallaro
5. "Anime and Manga: A Brief History" by Emma Clarendon
